title: World-Wide
text:
Russia is planning to fabricate a pretext for an invasion of Ukraine by releasing a staged video depicting attacks by Kyiv military forces, U.S. officials said, citing newly declassified intelligence.

Turkey and Ukraine signed a free-trade agreement and finalized a deal for Ukraine to manufacture Turkish armed drones.

---

The Biden administration expects a restored nuclear deal would leave Iran capable of amassing enough nuclear fuel for a bomb in significantly less than a year, a shorter time frame than the one that underpinned the 2015 accord, U.S. officials familiar with the matter said.

---

Four of U.K. leader Johnson's most senior aides quit, as the fallout from a probe into lockdown parties continues to reverberate at the top of the British government.

---

A Senate panel advanced bipartisan legislation that would limit the ability of Apple and Alphabet's Google to impose rules and fees on developers using their consumer-app stores.

---

The trial opened in Sarah Palin's defamation lawsuit against the New York Times.
